info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued December 26 at 3:14AM CST until December 26 at 6:00PM CST by NWS Amarillo
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM NOON TODAY TO 6 PM CST THIS EVENING FOR STRONG WINDS AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY VALUES FOR ALL OF THE OKLAHOMA AND TEXAS PANHANDLES... The National Weather Service in Amarillo has issued a Red Flag Warning for strong winds and low relative humidity values, which is in effect from noon today to 6 PM CST this evening. The Fire Weather Watch is no longer in effect. * Affected Area...In Oklahoma...Cimarron...Texas and Beaver. In Texas...Dallam...Sherman...Hansford...Ochiltree...Lipscomb... Hartley...Moore...Hutchinson...Roberts...Hemphill...Oldham... Potter...Carson...Gray...Wheeler...Deaf Smith...Randall... Armstrong...Donley...Collingsworth and Palo Duro Canyon. * 20 Foot Winds...Southwest winds of 20 to 35 mph with higher gusts are anticipated. * Relative Humidity...Minimum relative humidity values between 15 and 25 percent are expected. * Red Flag Threat Index...3 to 4, with isolated pockets of 5 in the western and central Oklahoma Panhandle. * Timing...Critical fire weather conditions are forecast to begin around Noon today and end by around 6 PM this evening.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now...or will shortly. A combination of strong winds...low relative humidity...and warm temperatures will create favorable weather for rapid fire growth and spread. Avoid activities that promote open flames and sparks.
